metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1. Which [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] shows one-half?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] halfway between 0 and 1.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Highlight the shaded region showing the first half

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. One-half means halfway between the start and end. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] See how the [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into two equal parts?

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draw an arrow from 0 to the tick at 1/2 to demonstrate the correct location

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find one-half on a [vocab]number line[/vocab]. [event:A_arrow] One-half is exactly halfway between 0 and 1 - right at the middle [vocab]tick mark[/vocab]. That's what makes it one-half.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at one-half.

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1, divided into thirds. Find the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at two-thirds.

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=2 denominator=3][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count two thirds from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts showing two thirds

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into thirds. [event:A_compare] Each interval represents one third. [event:A_compare_shaded] We need to count two of those thirds starting from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the tick at 2/3 to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find two-thirds on this [vocab]number line[/vocab]. The line is divided into three equal parts. Starting from zero, [event:A_arrow] we count two intervals to reach two-thirds. That's the tick mark at [fraction numerator=2 denominator=3]two thirds[/fraction].

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found two-thirds on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1, divided into fourths. Where would [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4]three fourths[/fraction] be?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count three fourths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line with equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts showing three fourths

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. Each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] represents one fourth. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] Start at zero and count three intervals to find [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4]three fourths[/fraction].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the third tick mark to show counting three fourths

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find this. To locate [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4]three fourths[/fraction], we start at zero and count three fourths. [event:A_arrow] See how the arrow shows us counting from 0 to the third tick mark? That's where [fraction numerator=3 denominator=4]three fourths[/fraction] is located on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found three-fourths on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: This [vocab]number line[/vocab] goes from 0 to 1 and is divided into sixths. Which tick mark shows where [fraction numerator=5 denominator=6]five sixths[/fraction] is located?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=5 denominator=6][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count five sixths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Highlight the sections to show the counting pattern

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into sixths, so [event:A_compare] each section represents one-sixth. You need to count five of those sections from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draw an arrow from 0 to the tick at 5/6 to demonstrate counting the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find five-sixths. Starting from zero, we count [event:A_arrow] five equal sections: one-sixth, two-sixths, three-sixths, four-sixths, five-sixths. The tick mark at the end of the fifth section is where five-sixths is located. That's how we find fractions on a [vocab]number line[/vocab].

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You found the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at five-sixths.

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1, divided into eighths. Find the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at seven-eighths.

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=7 denominator=8][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count seven eighths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal spacing

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts to highlight the counting pattern

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare]The number line is divided into 8 equal parts. [event:A_compare_shaded]To find [fraction numerator=7 denominator=8]seven eighths[/fraction], count seven intervals from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the seventh tick on the number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find this. [event:A_arrow]We start at zero and count seven equal jumps along the number line. Each jump represents one-eighth. So seven jumps gets us to the tick mark at seven-eighths. That's how we locate [fraction numerator=7 denominator=8]seven eighths[/fraction] on the number line.

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You found seven-eighths on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with one part shaded. Find the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab] that matches this [vocab]fraction[/vocab].

prompt.text: Select the tick mark that represents the shaded fraction.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look at how many equal parts the bar has.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare]The bar shows one part shaded out of four equal parts. [event:A_compare_shaded]Now find the tick mark that shows the same position on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the first tick on the number line to show the fraction 1/4

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match these. The bar has 4 equal parts with 1 part shaded - that's one-fourth. [event:A_arrow]The arrow shows us that the first tick mark after zero represents one-fourth on the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. That's the tick mark that matches the shaded part.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You matched the shaded part to one-fourth on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1 divided into sixths. Where would [fraction numerator=4 denominator=6]four sixths[/fraction] be?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=4 denominator=6][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count four sixths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts showing the first four intervals

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare] Each space between tick marks represents one sixth. [event:A_compare_shaded] Count four of those spaces starting from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the tick at 4/6 to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find [fraction numerator=4 denominator=6]four sixths[/fraction] on the number line. [event:A_arrow] We start at zero and count four sixths - one, two, three, four. That's where [fraction numerator=4 denominator=6]four sixths[/fraction] is located. See how we counted four equal spaces from zero?

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You found [fraction numerator=4 denominator=6]four sixths[/fraction] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: This [vocab]number line[/vocab] goes from 0 to 1 and is divided into eighths. Find the tick mark that shows [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction].

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count six eighths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts showing 6/8

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into eighths, so each space between tick marks represents one eighth. [event:A_compare] You need to count six of these equal spaces from zero to find [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction]. [event:A_compare_shaded] See how the shaded sections show you where [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction] is located?

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the tick at 6/8 to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find this. To locate [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction] on the number line, we start at zero and count six equal spaces. [event:A_arrow] This arrow shows us counting from 0 to the sixth tick mark - that's where [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction] is located. Each space is one eighth, so six spaces gives us [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction].

on_correct.dialogue: Correct. You identified the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at [fraction numerator=6 denominator=8]six eighths[/fraction].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1, divided into three equal parts. Which [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] shows where one-third is?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count one third from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts to highlight the first interval representing 1/3

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into three equal parts. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] Each part represents one third, so the first [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] after zero shows where one-third is.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the first tick mark to show the location of 1/3

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find one-third on the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. [event:A_arrow] We start at zero and move to the first tick mark. That's one out of three equal parts, which is one-third. See how the first tick shows exactly where [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction] is located.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found one-third on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1, divided into eighths. Where would [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8]three eighths[/fraction] be?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count three eighths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal intervals

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Highlight the intervals being counted

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. The [vocab]number line[/vocab] is divided into eighths, so [event:A_compare] each [vocab]interval[/vocab] represents one eighth. You need to count three of those intervals from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the tick at 3/8 to show counting the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8]three eighths[/fraction] on this number line. Starting at zero, we count three intervals: [event:A_arrow] one eighth, two eighths, three eighths. The third tick mark is where [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8]three eighths[/fraction] is located. See how we counted three equal jumps from zero?

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found [fraction numerator=3 denominator=8]three eighths[/fraction] on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: Here's a bar with some parts shaded. Below it is a [vocab]number line[/vocab] from 0 to 1. Which [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] shows the same [vocab]fraction[/vocab] as the shaded part?

prompt.text: Select the tick mark that represents the shaded fraction.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count how many parts are shaded in the bar.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the bar with equal parts

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts of the bar with equal parts

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. [event:A_compare][event:A_compare_shaded] The bar shows 2 out of 3 equal parts shaded. Find the tick mark that shows the same position on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the shaded tick on the number line to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to match these. The bar has 3 equal parts, and 2 are shaded - that's two-thirds. [event:A_arrow] The arrow shows us that the second tick mark from zero represents two-thirds on the [vocab]number line[/vocab]. That's how the bar and number line show the same [vocab]fraction[/vocab].

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. Two-thirds on the bar matches two-thirds on the [vocab]number line[/vocab].

metadata.goal_text: The student can select tick marks matching the given fraction on a number line.

steps.dialogue: This [vocab]number line[/vocab] goes from 0 to 1 and is divided into eighths. Find the tick mark that shows [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8]five eighths[/fraction].

prompt.text: Select the tick mark at [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8][/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count five eighths from zero.

events.name: A_compare
events.description: Compare all the parts of the number line to show equal spacing

events.name: A_compare_shaded
events.description: Compare the shaded parts to emphasize counting from zero

step.dialogue: Let's think about this together. Each [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] represents one eighth. [event:A_compare] See how the number line is divided into equal parts? [event:A_compare_shaded] Count five of those eighths starting from zero.

events.name: A_arrow
events.description: Draws an arrow from 0 to the tick at 5/8 to help count the fraction

step.dialogue: Let me show you how to find [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8]five eighths[/fraction] on this number line. The number line is divided into eighths, so each space represents one eighth. [event:A_arrow] Starting from zero, we count five eighths: one eighth, two eighths, three eighths, four eighths, five eighths. That's how we locate [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8]five eighths[/fraction] on the number line.

on_correct.dialogue: That's right. You found the [vocab]tick mark[/vocab] at [fraction numerator=5 denominator=8]five eighths[/fraction].
